content: 1. What kind of company is the board of directors?

answers.text: a) A large group with many subsidiaries.
b) a specialized technology provider.
c) a traditional chemical company.
d) a substitute software manufacturer.

content: 2. What is Martin Brüdermund's main division?

answers.text: a) software development
b) Financial services
c) chemical production
d) energy supply

content: 3. What type of management model is described in the description of the company?

answers.text: a) a hierarchical management model.
b) a decentralized management model.
c) a dualistic system.
d) a project management model.

content: 4. Which of the following statements best describes the role of the board?

answers.text: a) He is responsible for the company's daily administration.
b) He is the top decision -maker in the company.
c) He monitors the company's business and makes strategic decisions.
d) He is responsible for the company's financial planning.

content: 5. Which of the following factors can influence the decision -making of the board?

answers.text: a) only the corporate strategy
b) only the financial situation of the company
c) The interests of shareholders, stakeholders and the long -term corporate goals
d) only the working conditions of the employees

content: 6. What type of technology is offered in the company?

answers.text: a) automated production lines
b) Cloud-based software solutions
c) Production of chemicals
d) robotics and artificial intelligence

content: 7. Which of the following statements best describes the meaning of conflicts of interest?

answers.text: a) Interest conflicts are only relevant for large companies.
b) Interest conflicts can lead to bad decisions.
c) Interest conflicts are a common problem in companies.
d) Interest conflicts can only be found in small companies.

content: 8. Which of the following statements is best on the concept of agency theory?

answers.text: a) The agency theory is only relevant for large companies.
b) The agency theory states that the interests of the owners can conflict with the interests of the management positions.
c) Agency theory describes the relationship between companies and its employees.
d) Agency theory is a purely theoretical theory.

content: 9. Which of the following statements best describes the role of the board in corporate management?

answers.text: a) The board is only responsible for financial planning.
b) The board is responsible for the strategic orientation of the company.
c) The board is responsible for the company's daily administration.
d) The board is only responsible for recruiting.

content: 10. What is the main division of Thomas Brüdermund?

answers.text: a) software development
b) Financial services
c) chemical production
d) energy supply

content: 11. Which of the following statements best applies to the Arcandor company?

answers.text: a) Arcandor is a large and established company.
b) Arcandor is a small and specialized provider.
c) Arcandor is a substitute software manufacturer.
d) Arcandor is a multinational company.

content: 12. Which of the following statements best describes the relationship between the German model and the international model?

answers.text: a) The German model is always better than the international model.
b) The German model is a model for the international model.
c) The German model is a unique system with its own special features.
d) The international model is always the best solution.

content: 13. Which of the following statements best describes the importance of the corporate structure?

answers.text: a) The corporate structure is irrelevant for corporate management.
b) The corporate structure influences the decision -making of the board.
c) The corporate structure is an important tool for strategic planning.
d) The corporate structure is only relevant for small companies.

content: 14. Which of the following statements best describes the role of corporate management?

answers.text: a) Company management is only responsible for financial planning.
b) Company management is responsible for the strategic orientation of the company.
c) Company management is only responsible for recruiting.
d) Company management is only responsible for compliance with regulations.

content: 15. Which of the following statements best describes the meaning of competition?

answers.text: a) Competition is only a cost factor.
b) Competition is important for the company's innovative strength.
c) Competition is an important factor in the company's profitability.
d) Competition is a danger to the company.

content: 16. Which of the following is an example of a long -term corporate strategy?

answers.text: a) a short -term profit maximization plan.
b) a plan for the development of new markets.
c) a plan for the development of new products and services.
d) a plan for reducing production costs.

content: 17. Which of the following is an example of an investment?

answers.text: a) A training offer for employees.
b) a purchase of machines.
c) a research project.
d) a travel budget.

content: 18. Which of the following statements best describes the meaning of financing models?

answers.text: a) Financing models are only relevant for large companies.
b) Financing models are important for ensuring the liquidity of the company.
c) Financing models are an important part of the corporate strategy.
d) Financing models are only relevant for small companies.
